Wisdom: الْمُنْصِفُ كَرِيمٌ الظَّالِمُ لَئِيمٌ
enWisdom: The equitable person is noble whereas the oppressor is wicked

Wisdom: الْإِنْصَافُ عُنْوَانُ النُّبْلِ
enWisdom: Equity is a symbol of nobility

Wisdom: الْإِنْصَافُ شِيمَةُ الْأَشْرَافِ
enWisdom: Equity is a trait of the honourable ones

Wisdom: الْإِنْصَافُ أَفْضَلُ الْفَضَائِلِ
enWisdom: Equity is the most superior of merits

Wisdom: الْإِنْصَافُ أَفْضَلُ الشِّيَمِ
enWisdom: Equity is the best of traits

Wisdom: الْمُؤْمِنُ [مَنْ‏] يُنْصِفُ مَنْ لَا يُنْصِفُهُ
enWisdom: A believer is fair to the one who is unfair to him

Wisdom: الْإِنْصَافُ مِنَ النَّفْسِ كَالْعَدْلِ فِي الْإِمْرَةِ
enWisdom: Being equitable with others is like being just [while] in authority

Wisdom: الْمُنْصِفُ كَثِيرُ الْأَوْلِيَاءِ وَالْأَوِدَّاءِ
enWisdom: The equitable person has many friends and intimates

Wisdom: أَنْصِفِ النَّاسَ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ وَأَهْلِكَ وَخَاصَّتِكَ وَمَنْ لَكَ فِيهِ هَوًى وَاعْدِلْ فِي الْعَدُوِّ وَالصَّدِيقِ
enWisdom: Be equitable to people over yourself, your family, your near ones and those from whom you desire something, and be just with both enemy and friend

Wisdom: أَجْوَرُ السِّيرَةِ أَنْ تَنْتَصِفَ مِنَ النَّاسِ وَلَا تُعَامِلْهُمْ بِهِ
enWisdom: The most unjust conduct is for you to seek equity from people while not dealing with them in the same way

Wisdom: أَعْدَلُ السِّيرَةِ أَنْ تُعَامِلَ النَّاسَ بِمَا تُحِبُّ أَنْ يُعَامِلُوكَ بِهِ
enWisdom: The most equitable conduct is for you to deal with people in the way you would like them to deal with you

Wisdom: أَعْدَلُ النَّاسِ مَنْ أَنْصَفَ مِنْ ظُلْمِهِ
enWisdom: The most just of all people is he who is equitable to the one who has oppressed him

Wisdom: أَعْدَلُ النَّاسِ مَنْ أَنْصَفَ عَنْ قُوَّةٍ وَأَعْظَمُهُمْ حِلْماً مَنْ حَلُمَ عَنْ قُدْرَةٍ
enWisdom: The most just of all people is he who is equitable despite having power, and the one who has the greatest clemency is he who is clement despite having authority

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَعْظَمَ الْمَثُوبَةِ مَثُوبَةُ الْإِنْصَافِ
enWisdom: Indeed the greatest reward is the reward of [justice and] equity

Wisdom: إِنَّكَ إِنْ أَنْصَفْتَ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ أَزْلَفَكَ اللَّهُ
enWisdom: Verily if you show fairness to others, Allah will bring you closer [to Him]

Wisdom: ثَلَاثَةٌ لَا يَنْتَصِفُونَ مِنْ ثَلَاثَةٍ أَبَداً الْعَاقِلُ مِنَ الْأَحْمَقِ وَالْبَرُّ مِنَ الْفَاجِرِ وَالْكَرِيمُ مِنَ اللَّئِيمِ
enWisdom: Three types of people never seek justice from three other types: the intelligent person from the fool, the virtuous from the vicious, and the noble one from the wicked

Wisdom: عَامِلْ سَائِرَ النَّاسِ بِالْإِنْصَافِ وَعَامِلِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ بِالْإِيثَارِ
enWisdom: Treat all the [other] people with equity but treat the believers with altruism [and prefer them over yourself]

Wisdom: غَايَةُ الْإِنْصَافِ أَنْ يُنْصِفَ الْمَرْءُ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: The height of equity is for a person to be equitable with himself

Wisdom: مَنْ تَحَلَّى بِالْإِنْصَافِ بَلَغَ مَرَاتِبَ الْأَشْرَافِ
enWisdom: Whoever adorns himself with equity attains the [lofty] ranks of honour

Wisdom: نِظَامُ الدِّينِ خَصْلَتَانِ إِنْصَافُكَ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ وَمُوَاسَاةُ إِخْوَانِكَ
enWisdom: The structure of religion is [based on] two qualities: your impartiality towards yourself and supporting your brethren
